person.persName: James Bennett McCreary (Madison County, KY, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Son of Dr. Edmund R. and Sabrina McCreary. Graduated from Centre College in Danville in 1857. Earned a law degree from Cumberland University in Tennessee in 1859. Attorney in Madison County in 1860. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. After the Battle of Richmond in August 1862, joined the newly formed Confederate 11th Kentucky Cavalry as a Major. Promoted to lieutenant colonel in July 1863. Captured at the Battle of Buffington Island, Ohio. Prisoner of war in Cincinnati, Ohio; Fort Delaware, Delaware; and Morris Island, South Carolina. Released in August 1863 as part of a prisoner exchange. Resumed command of a Confederate battalion in late 1863, and served in that capacity until the end of the war.
